segment_metadata.text_summary: This text segment from the Gospel of Luke contains two distinct parts. The first is a genealogy of Jesus, tracing his lineage back to Adam and ultimately to God. This establishes Jesus's place within human history and his divine origin. The second part details Jesus's temptation in the wilderness by the devil. The devil tempts Jesus with food, worldly power, and a test of God's protection, but Jesus resists each temptation by quoting scripture. This section highlights Jesus's obedience to God and his commitment to his mission, even in the face of adversity. Following the temptation, Jesus returns to Galilee and begins his ministry, teaching in synagogues and gaining recognition. He then goes to Nazareth, where he reads from the prophet Isaiah, proclaiming that he is the fulfillment of the prophecy, anointed to preach good news to the poor, freedom to the captives, and recovery of sight to the blind.
